definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
deep/profound/(of a person) reserved/undemonstrative/(of a voice, sound etc) deep/low-pitched
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered

sentences.english: Andrew's face fell when he was told he couldn' t go on the trip.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁听说他不能去旅游时脸沉了下来。

sentences.english: The water was blessedly deep and we went down like stones.

sentences.english: It's something where there is a really heavy thing based at one corner, and there's a lot of dials and gauges and everything.

sentences.english: My heart sank as I heard the pain in his voice.

sentences.english: At last he did, he tied the boat to metal ring that was stuck in the rocks.

definition: (of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
